title: minerjones
author: minerjones
content: LOT 1: Time "Into The Metaverse", August 8 2022 CGC 8.5LOT 2: The Economist "Crypto's Downfall", November 19 2022 CGC 8.5LOT 3: Bloomberg Markets "The Crypto Issue" April-May 2022 CGC 9.0LOT 4: Time "The Prince of Crypto Has Concerns" March 28 2022 CGC 6.5LOT 5: The Economist "Down The Rabbit Hole" September 18 2021 CGC 9.0LOT 6: Bloomberg Businessweek "Bitcoin Dreams" January 13 2014 CGC 6.5 STARTING BID PER LOT: 0.0014BTCMINIMUM BID INCREMENT PER LOT: 0.0002BTC**Please limit bids to ONLY 4 decimal places**END TIME: JUNE 18th, 2023, 14:00:00 PDT**Payment due within 24 hours of auction end!!**SNIPE: Any bid made in last 5 minutes PER LOT will extend the auction 5 minutes beyond the ending time PER LOT.If within those 5 extended minutes, a new bid is made, 5 minutes will be added to the auction from the time of that bid PER LOT.PAYMENT: Bitcoin BTC. A signed PGP message will be sent to winner with payment addressSHIPPING: Based on location and preferenceOWNER: NOT DISCLOSED

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Some really cool magazines (and covers) here.I was wondering how "bad" a 6.5 rating for a mag is. Found this article: https://collectingoldmagazines.com/magazine-resources/grading/ Seems like 6.5 is still quite good condition.Lot 1: 0.0014Lot 5: 0.0014Lot 6: 0.0016

comments.author: tweetious
comments.body: Question concerning Lot 6:Is the address label on the front page covered with "correction fluid"? Or the address is still visible (but hidden/photoshopped in the OP image)Any chance of a close-up image of that section? (only in case it is covered, no need to publicly exposure the address). Thank you.

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: Kryptowerk on June 13, 2023, 09:36:48 PMLot 1: 0.0014Lot 5: 0.0014Quote from: Spokanistan51 on June 13, 2023, 10:37:18 PMLot 6: 0.0018Quote from: tweetious on June 13, 2023, 10:10:55 PMQuestion concerning Lot 6:Is the address label on the front page covered with "correction fluid"? Or the address is still visible (but hidden/photoshopped in the OP image)Any chance of a close-up image of that section? (only in case it is covered, no need to publicly exposure the address). Thank you.It appears to be a white label/sticker on top and looks like the name/address was crossed out with a dark marker/pen underneath
